intro: Palicourea quadrilateralis, commonly known as the four-angled palicourea, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, elliptical berries. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is valued for its ornamental appeal and medicinal properties. Its unique four-angled stem and persistent leaves make it easily recognizable in its natural habitat.
